markdown.markdown: Geospatial intelligence combines satellite imagery, drone data, and AI-powered mapping to optimize land use, climate resilience, and crop targeting. In Western Kenya, this approach is especially powerful for region-specific crops like sugarcane, coffee, maize, beans, and bananas. --- ## Crop-Specific Applications ### Sugarcane - Map high-yield zones based on soil moisture and slope. - Monitor ratoon crop performance using NDVI time series. - Detect waterlogging and plan drainage interventions. ### Coffee - Identify altitude bands optimal for Arabica cultivation. - Overlay shade tree coverage and pest risk zones. - Support certification (Rainforest Alliance, Fairtrade) with traceable maps. ### Maize - Predict drought stress using thermal and vegetation indices. - Guide fertilizer application via soil nutrient maps. - Track seasonal yield variation across counties. ### Beans & Pulses - Cluster agroecological zones for intercropping strategies. - Detect pest hotspots using farmer-uploaded geotagged images. - Model rainfall reliability for short-cycle crops. ### Bananas & Horticulture - Map irrigation potential using proximity to rivers and slope. - Detect disease spread (e.g., banana wilt) via drone imagery. - Plan cold chain logistics from farm to market. --- ## Strategic Partnerships ### Kenya Seed Company - Target seed varieties to optimal zones using soil and climate data. - Support demo plots and monitor performance via satellite. - Map seed distribution networks and overlay farmer adoption rates. ### Village Industrial (VI) - Identify strategic locations for VI-supported aggregation hubs. - Optimize supply chains with route analytics and cold chain planning. - Empower youth-led drone teams for aerial data collection and analysis. --- [Reach out](mailto:info@lighthouseanalytics.ke)
